message_1: A right triangle has a hypotenuse of 10 cm and one of its angles measures 30 degrees. Find the length of the side opposite the 30 degree angle.
message_2:
To find the length of the side opposite the 30-degree angle, we can use the sine function in trigonometry. The sine function is defined as the ratio of the length of the side opposite the angle to the length of the hypotenuse. In this case, we have:

sin(30) = opposite side / hypotenuse

sin(30) = opposite side / 10 cm

Since sin(30) = 1/2, we can write:

1/2 = opposite side / 10 cm

Now, we can solve for the opposite side:

opposite side = 1/2 * 10 cm
opposite side = 5 cm

So, the length of the side opposite the 30-degree angle is 5 cm.
